insights.title: Supplier base collapsed to a single vendor
insights.observation: In the last 90 days you purchased from only 1 supplier versus 10 suppliers historically (‑90%). The industry average is 3.7 suppliers per period.
insights.recommendation: Re‑engage with previously used suppliers and qualify at least 2‑3 additional vendors to diversify risk and improve negotiating leverage.

insights.title: Spend concentration on two products
insights.observation: Two products (Tarsons Desiccator Vacuums 300 & 200) account for 87.8% of the period spend (13.5M). Historically spend is spread across many SKUs.
insights.recommendation: Conduct a SKU rationalization review; negotiate bulk discounts for these high‑volume items and explore alternative suppliers to reduce dependence.

insights.title: Period spend far below industry norm
insights.observation: Current period spend is $13.5 M, which is 80% lower than the platform average spend of $65.9 M (‑80%).
insights.recommendation: Analyze demand forecasts and inventory policies to identify unmet procurement opportunities; consider consolidating spend to achieve economies of scale.

insights.title: Average price per unit dropped significantly vs history
insights.observation: Avg price per unit fell from $4,495.60 historically to $2,621.44 now (‑41.7%). The industry average price per unit is about $3,452, making your current price 24% lower than the benchmark.
insights.recommendation: Leverage the lower unit cost to renegotiate contracts for other categories and lock in favorable pricing before potential market increases.

insights.title: Quantity and item count lagging behind peers
insights.observation: You purchased 5,160 units across 7 items, versus the industry averages of 19,097 units and 18.7 items (‑73% and ‑62% respectively). Historical averages are 12,913 units and 21 items.
insights.recommendation: Review demand planning and inventory turnover to ensure procurement aligns with operational needs; consider expanding the catalog to support upcoming projects.

insights.title: Shift away from high‑value categories
insights.observation: Historically the top spend category is Cryosurgery equipment ($27.46 M). In the current period the only recorded category spend is Water treatment ($11.6 K), indicating a dramatic shift away from core high‑value categories.
insights.recommendation: Assess whether the drop is due to project completion, budgeting, or supplier issues; if strategic, re‑allocate budget to maintain capability in critical categories.
